goals.question: What is the distribution of penguin species in the dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the proportion of each penguin species in the dataset.

goals.question: What is the average body mass of each penguin species?
goals.visualization: Box plot of body mass by penguin species
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us compare the body mass of each penguin species and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between flipper length and body mass?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of flipper length vs body mass
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation between flipper length and body mass.

goals.question: What is the distribution of penguin sexes in the dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the proportion of male and female penguins in the dataset.

goals.question: What is the distribution of penguin island locations in the dataset?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of penguin island locations
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the proportion of penguins from each island location in the dataset.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    species_counts = data['species'].value_counts()
    species_counts.plot(kind='bar', color=['blue', 'orange', 'green'])
    plt.xlabel('Species')
    plt.ylabel('Count')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of penguin species in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(species_counts.index)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    sns.boxplot(x='species', y='body_mass_g', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the average body mass of each penguin species?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Penguin Species')
    plt.ylabel('Body Mass (g)')
    plt.legend(title='Species', loc='upper right')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['flipper_length_mm'], data['body_mass_g'])
    plt.xlabel('Flipper Length (mm)')
    plt.ylabel('Body Mass (g)')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between flipper length and body mass?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sex_counts = data['sex'].value_counts()
    plt.pie(sex_counts, labels=sex_counts.index, autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of penguin sexes in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(sex_counts.index, title="Sex", loc="upper right")
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    island_counts = data['island'].value_counts()
    islands = island_counts.index
    counts = island_counts.values
    
    plt.bar(islands, counts)
    plt.xlabel('Island')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Penguins')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of penguin island locations in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(islands)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
